title: Technavio Reports the Demand for Premium Juice Will Boost the Juice Market in the US Through 2019

Mon, Aug 31, 2015, 16:26 BST - UK Markets closed for Summer Bank holiday Technavio Reports the Demand for Premium Juice Will Boost the Juice Market in the US Through 2019 Press Release : Technavio Research – 21 minutes ago Print 
LONDON--(BUSINESSWIRE)-- 
Technavio has published a new report on the juice market in the US ,which is expected to grow at a CAGR of more than 1% from 2015-2019. 
About the Report 
In accordance with the latest report by Technavio, the demand for premium juice will continue to grow, especially with the recovery of the US economy from the 2008 to 2009 recession. Bold and indulgent flavors and products with innovative packaging are in demand among consumers. 
“The premium juice demand in the US increased after Starbucks bought Evolution Fresh in 2011, a line of cold-pressed vegetable and fruit juices. Tru-Juice is also a premium brand for fruit juices in the US,” says Faisal Ghaus, Vice President of Technavio. 
The latest report by Technavio also emphasizes the increased popularity of juices derived from vegetables, as vegetable juices are high in nutritional content and low in sugar and calorie content, unlike fruit juice. 
“Although the juice market in the US is dominated by the fruit juice segment, the vegetable juice market is growing at a rapid rate,” adds Ghaus. 
Market Scope and Calculation of Market Size 
The new Technavio report covers the present scenario and growth prospects of the juice market in the US from 2015-2019. The report considers revenue generated and volume consumed from food service and retail sales of fruit juices and vegetable juice products to calculate the market size.
